de.tub.pes.syscir.engine.transformers

Interface KnownFunctionTransformer


  • public interface KnownFunctionTransformer
    This is the base interface for every known function transformer in STATE. A known function is defined as a function that exists in the SystemC library or any other C++ library that is included in the input model, but is not part of the model's source code. In KaSCPar, the SystemC parser used to parse the input SystemC models in STATE, does not process C++ include directives, which means that the code of these known functions is not available in XML and hence can not be analyzed automatically.

    To make a library function available in STATE, one has to create a known function transformer, a concrete class that implements this interface, either directly or through extending AbstractFunction. To associate a known function transformer class with a function, an entry in the functions definition file in the configuration folder has to be created. Please see the documentation on configuration files.

    If a call to such a function occurs, the responsible transformer requests the associated transformer from the TransformerFactory. If it is used for the first time, the factory loads the class using a class loader. Then the transformer of the node containing the function call calls #createFunctionCall(String, Stack, List, Map, TAModel, SCModel), and leaves therepresentation of the function to the known function transformer. This creates a maximum of flexibility in representing library functions as there are no restrictions on manipulating the internal models.

    Author:
    Joachim Fellmuth

      void createFunctionCall(java.lang.String name, java.util.Stack<java.lang.String> prefixes, java.util.List<java.lang.String> arguments, Environment e)
      In implementing classes this method is intended to represent a library method call in the given internal models.

    • Method Detail

      • createFunctionCall

        void createFunctionCall(java.lang.String name,
                      java.util.Stack<java.lang.String> prefixes,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> arguments,
                      Environment e)
        In implementing classes this method is intended to represent a library method call in the given internal models. Apart from the limitations of the internal models, there are no further restrictions or guidelines on how to represent the function code. Please see the existing implementations for examples.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the function
        prefixes - The prefix stack representing the reference structure of the call. Can be used to determine in which class the method is defined.
        arguments - String arguments
        environment - The current environment, storing transient information of the parsing process
        ta - The current internal Uppaal model
        sc - The current internal SystemC model
